page.title: 06EDUCATIONAL CHANGE
page.content: 1985 was an important year for education in the Brighouse area. The eleven-plus examination was abolished and selective secondary education was replaced by a comprehensive system. Existing Grammar Schools were merged with the Secondary Modern Schools to form the new High Schools. After a history dating back to 1621, Rastrick Grammar School was amalgamated with the newer Reins Wood School,which itself originated as a British and Foreign Bible Society school, opened at Rastrick Common in 1832. The new Rastrick High School was to cater for 800 local children. Brighouse Girls'Grammar School also became a co-educational High School. Reorganisation came after a decade of local controversy. One old established school opted out of the state system and became independent.
